712442f-a.text:
East 38th Street, south side, west from First Ave. The gasoline station shown in the foreground, is at the S.W. corner of First Ave. Also
shown is the Second Ave. Elevated Line.
October 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

712444f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, west from First Avenue, showing mainly the southerly side of this thoroughfare. Running diagonally thru the corner property at the left are the tubes of the Queens Midtown tunnel. The former tenements standing at this site were demolished in 1929 to make way for a gsOline station and which in time was razed for the present improvement in April 1938. The adjoining buildings will follow in the Fall of 1939. To the right is the Eleto Co. warehouse, housing the delivery services of "1United Parcels". This structure was erectend in late 1928.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New Yorl City Tunnel Authority

712446f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, north side, east from Second to Birst Avenues, showing at the various coners (left to right) the 16 story apartment house (W'o. 30l E), the Eleto Co. Warehouse
and the Consolidated Edison Co. power house.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

712448f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, north side, west from (Wo. 315, right) a point between First and Second Avenues, and acroso the latter. At the P. E. corner of Second Avenue appewrs a lb story apartment house (No. 301 E. ) erected in 1928. Across the Avenue, and midway between Third, is the J. C. G. Hupel's Brewery. The shadowy portion above same is the upper part of the office structure
known as No. 1O E. 4Oth Street.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel A.thority

712447f-a.text:
E. 38th Street, south side, west from (No. 316 left) a point between First and Second Avenue and to the latter. Note the political signs at the left indicating the Congressional 1938 struggle between incuribent John J. C'Connor and the successful cansdidate JJames H, Fay. This contest had national attention because of Adminstration interest. The name of Israel Amter indicates the Communist party's candidate for Governor of the State of New York.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York -ity Tunnel Authority
